1

About

Hello, my name is Karel Vuong.

Design and development is the name of the game. I earn my bread primarily with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript development but I will happily play around with any language on any end of the stack.

Professionally, I am currently working in Waterloo with BlackBerry as an Applications Developer. I serve as the sole developer and designer for the non-profit 1 Million Music Moments and provide consulting services at Innovitas.

Academically, I am a candidate for a Bachelor of Science — Computer Science at the University of Toronto and am in my third year of studies.

I like to think of myself as a generalist. I believe strongly in the notion that all individuals should embrace knowledge and develop their capabilities as fully as possible. By taking on different disciplines, having dynamic mindsets, and being adaptive, all of this will allow us to bring ideas together into a broader fabric of understanding.

It may seem like just about everybody is into this stuff these days, but here are a couple things I am interested in:

  • I am fascinated with the concept of openness. This speaks to several open movements, but more specifically, open data and open source initiatives. With regards to open data, over my lifetime, I have already seen a shift on multiple fronts. At the government level, open data has begun to increase both transparency and accountability. Even more exciting is the enabling of third parties to leverage this data to develop applications and services that can now address public and private demands. Open source development is also very exciting. The idea of a collaborative effort to improve something with no gain apart from the betterment of the product is empowering. GitHub is a wonderful site and community that has really propelled this movement forward over the last couple years. Plus their mascot, the Octocat, is pretty sweet.
  • I am also captivated by wearable technology. It was said by Forbes that 2014 will be the year of wearable tech. I look forward to the day where I will be able to fully quantify every aspect of my life. Statistics galore!
2

Work

  • 1 Million Music Moments

    Web

    A community organization that seeks to strengthen the City of Toronto's reputation as a premier musical and cultural centre by creating a connective tissue that acts as a fabric through social media to engage the greater community and demonstrate to the world all of the great talent that Toronto has to offer.

  • Flow

    Web

    A business process management platform that is a full rebuild of a current platform used by over 30% of all BlackBerry employees. Flow features applications within the platform that can be fully customized to offer comprehensive workflow management, dynamic forms, social collaboraton, and a modelling suite that is suitable for every use-case like the tracking of inventory, processes, parcel delivery, and much more.

  • Clinico

    Mobile

    A mobile application that transforms clinical trial protocols into interactive, engaging, patient-focused platforms for discovering and understanding clinical research and data.

  • Cooler

    Mobile

    A tool that allows designers to create colour schemes and palettes using an algorithm that performs real-time colour manipulation.

  • Cella

    Mobile

    A home inventory management system that securely stores location, purchase and warranty information of possessions and can generate insurance reports in the event of a disaster or emergency.
